page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS.
page.content: Our area includes part of Penzance,the whole of Newlyn. The villages of Paul and Tredavoe. The coastline is mainly of rock and pebble and from the beaches you can see St.Michaels Mount and across to the Lizard Peninsula . Locals say that when the Lizard is clearly defined it will rain. Penlee Quarry is a conspicuous sight in Mounts Bay between Newlyn and Mousehole and at Wherry town just over a hundred years ago there was a mine (The Wherry)operating actually in the sea,a few hundred yards off the present promenade. The rocks on which it was built can still be seen at low tide.
